issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: take HADOOP_CLASSPATH off of the appendable list for trunk

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description: In MAPREDUCE-6454 (target for branch-2.x), we provide a way with constraints to pass built-in classpath from parent to child shell, via HADOOP_CLASSPATH, so jars in distributed cache can still work in child tasks. In trunk, we may think some way different, like: involve additional env var to safely pass build-in classpath.
fields.summary: Figure out the way to pass build-in classpath (files in distributed cache, etc.) from parent to spawned shells

comments.body: Re-assigning this to me and updating the description to reflect reality, since I actually understand how bash works.

bq. Re-assigning this to me and updating the description to reflect reality, since I actually understand how bash works.
Please feel free to take it if you have bandwidth to work on it immediately.

-00:
* MAPREDUCE-6454 but with HADOOP_CLASSPATH renamed to the not-already-used HADOOP_TASK_CLASSPATH
* added finalize code for HADOOP_TASK_CLASSPATH via a new hadoop_add_task_classpath function.
* hadoop_add_task_classpath safely verifies the path is valid, puts it in a decent place order-wise, etc, etc
* added shell unit tests for hadoop_add_task_classpath
* modified shell unit tests for hadoop_finalize_classpath
* added HADOOP_TASK_CLASSPATH to hadoop-config.cmd for Windows
